title: X Factor Celebrity: Vinnie Jones supported by Charles Bronson
text:
Vinnie Jones has been backed up by Charles Bronson as he watches from behind bars (Pictures: REX)

Vinnie Jones’s X Factor Celebrity debut has earned himself some new fans – including Charles Bronson, who sent him a voice message from behind bars, say reports.

The notorious UK con – who has been in and out of prison over a string of violent offences since 1974 – reportedly made the call from Frankland Prison, County Durham, to wish the former football hardnut luck on the show.

In a recording obtained by The Sun on Sunday, Bronson – who now goes by the name Salvador after the artist Salvador Dali – is heard praising him and his family, calling him a ‘good man’.

He’s heard saying: ‘Honestly the way you come across, you’re a proper geezer. It’s tough for you. You’ve lost a bloody diamond of your life.

‘But the way you put it over really touched me mate. I thought f***ing brilliant. It (will) get easier with time. No doubt.’

‘I was sitting here, I thought blimey, from hod carrier to Hollywood, marrying that beautiful, beautiful lady. You was a good husband. She was a good wife,’ he continued.

‘Be strong mate.’

Charles’s message came before Vinnie made his X Factor debut performing Blues Brothers track Everybody Needs Somebody on the live shows on Saturday – earning a standing ovation in the process.

Vinnie got a standing ovation after his performance (Picture: Rex)

In a pre-recorded video, he paid tribute to his wife Tanya, who died just ahead of his initial audition.

‘My wife, Tans, she was just like, “You have got to do it. Please do it”. She loves the show.

‘Soon after Tanya passed I decided I’ve got to do it for her legacy and we will carry that legacy on.

More: The X Factor Who left X Factor: Celebrity last night in the first live show of the series? X Factor fans call for Jenny Ryan to sing next James Bond theme as she smashes live show Simon Cowell 'tried to keep' Jenny Ryan from being eliminated from X Factor: Celebrity

‘In her name we will try and win this.’

While he made it through to the next round, Olivia Olson and Ricki Lake became the first two stars to be sent home.

X Factor: Celebrity returns next Saturday at 8.30pm on ITV.
